transportAdvice: Krabi town and its beaches are spread out, making walking impractical between major areas; songthaews (shared pickup trucks) and longtail boats serve popular tourist routes, while metered and negotiated taxis are widely available for longer transfers. Renting a scooter or hiring a private vehicle is common for exploring the region independently.

weather.description: Cool and dry with clear skies, making it the peak season for beach and island activities.
Warm and sunny with very little rainfall, ideal conditions for snorkeling and rock climbing.
Hot and mostly dry, one of the best months for calm seas and outdoor exploration.
Heat intensifies and occasional showers begin to appear, though sunny spells remain frequent.
Southwest monsoon arrives bringing regular heavy rain and rougher seas around the islands.
Wet season is well underway with frequent downpours and reduced ferry services to outer islands.
Continued heavy rainfall and strong winds; some boat trips and island tours may be suspended.
One of the wettest months with persistent rain, though short dry windows still occur between storms.
Rainfall remains heavy and seas can be rough, making this a quieter period for tourism.
Monsoon begins to ease toward the end of the month but rain is still frequent and heavy at times.
Transition month with decreasing rain and improving conditions as the dry season approaches.
Dry season returns with pleasant temperatures and calm seas, marking the start of peak tourist season.
